intro: Hieracium stirovacense subsp. durmitoricum, commonly known as the Durmitoricum hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow composite flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific leaf morphology and habitat preferences. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and localized species within its range.
